optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Shield
entries: You can use your action to create a pact shield in your empty hand. You can choose the exact form that it takes each time you create it. You are proficient with it while you wield it.

Your pact shield disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the shield (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic shield into your pact shield by performing a special ritual while you hold the shield. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest.

You can then dismiss the shield, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact shield thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient shield in this way. The shield ceases being your pact shield if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different shield, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The shield appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Bash
entries: You can use your pact shield as a martial melee weapon. It deals 1 point of bludgeoning damage. It counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
If you have the ability to add your Charisma modifier to a weapon's attack and damage, you may also do so with your pact shield.
If the shield has a magic bonus to its AC, it gets an equal bonus to its attack and damage rolls.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can perform a shield attack in addition to your normal attack.

optionalfeature.name: Shield Toss
entries: As an action, you can hurl your pact shield like a boomerang. Make a ranged weapon attack against up to two targets you can see within 30 feet of you. If it hits, it deals {@dice 3d4} + the appropriate ability modifier bludgeoning damage. If you score a critical hit with this attack and the target is size Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The shield returns to your grip after you throw it. At 11th level and 17th level, you can target an additional creature with this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Bulwark
entries: As a bonus action or a reaction when you or an ally within this effect's area is attacked or forced to make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw for half or no damage, you can project a bastion of power in a 10-foot radius around yourself. Until the end of your next turn, you and your allies in that area get a +2 bonus on such saving throws and to AC. You can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Great Bulwark
entries: Bulwark's area increases to a 30-foot radius and the bonus to AC and saving throws becomes +4.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Shield
entries: You can use any shield you summon with your Pact of the Shield feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
In addition, the shield gains a +1 bonus to its AC, unless it is a magic shield that already has a bonus to its AC.

optionalfeature.name: Superior Pact Shield
entries: You can use any shield you summon with your Pact of the Shield feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
In addition, your pact shield gains a +2 bonus to its AC, unless it is a magic shield that already has a bonus to its AC.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Pact Shield
entries: You can use any shield you summon with your Pact of the Shield feature as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.
In addition, your pact shield gains a +3 bonus to its AC, unless it is a magic shield that already has a bonus to its AC.

optionalfeature.name: Heroic Guardian
entries: You can cast {@spell Armor of Agathys} or {@spell Heroism} (if you know them) as a reaction when you or your mount is hit by an attack or become {@condition frightened}. If you do so, you can't again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shining Servant
entries: When you cast a warlock cantrip or a 1st level warlock spell (even one cast at a higher level), you can change the damage to radiant damage.
In addition, when you hit with an attack, you can deal extra radiant damage equal to your warlock level. If you do so, you can't again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dawnbringer
entries: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra radiant damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). You can't also benefit from {@optfeature Lifedrinker}.

optionalfeature.name: Hero's Steed
entries: You know the spell {@spell Find Steed}. For you, it is a warlock spell and it doesn't count against the limit on the number of spells you know. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
The summoned creature has additional hit points equal to twice your warlock level.

optionalfeature.name: Hero's Legendary Steed
entries: You know the spell {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE}. For you, it is a warlock spell and it doesn't count against the limit on the number of spells you know.

When you use your {@optfeature Hero's Steed|WarlockHero} invocation, you may instead cast {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE} once without expending a spell slot. In addition to the extra hit points from the Hero's Steed invocation, the summoned creature's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage and it has a bonus on attack rolls and saving throws and to its AC equal to half your proficiency bonus.
When you cast {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE}, you may summon a {@creature Drake|WarlockHero}.

action.name: Multitattack
entries: The drake makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake exhales energy in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 5d6}) damage on a failed save, or half on a success. The damage is the same type that the drake has resistance to. If the damage type is cold, radiant, or thunder, the saving throw is Constitution instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: The Hero
entries: You have made a pact with a hero of legend. Seeing in you the seeds of greatness, they grant you the power to overcome impossible odds and inspire others to victory. Potential patrons include Artoria Pendragon, Drizzt Do'Urden, Minsc, and Pike Trickfoot.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Hero lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you. When you cast {@spell Aid} or {@spell Death Ward} with a warlock spell slot (not Mystic Arcanum), the spell ends when you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Battle-Ready
entries: At 1st level, your patron tutors you in the art of combat. You gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

The influence of your patron also allows you to mystically channel your will through a particular weapon. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with and that lacks the two-handed property. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. This benefit lasts until you finish a long rest. If you later gain the {@optfeature Pact of the Blade} feature, this benefit extends to every pact weapon you conjure with that feature, no matter the weapon's type.

subclassFeature.name: Moment of Greatness
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can call upon your patron for inspiration. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits.

items: You have advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the beginning of your next turn.
You gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier for 1 hour.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must wait until you finish a short or long rest to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Steely Negotiator
entries: At 6th level, your patron teaches you that conflicts are not always won on the battlefield. You gain proficiency in {@skill Persuasion} or {@skill Insight} (your choice). If you are already proficient in both, then gain proficiency in any other skill available to warlocks.
You also know the spell {@spell Zone of Truth}. For you, it is a warlock spell and it doesn't count against the limit on the number of spells you know.
You can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Duel of Destiny
entries: Although you prefer to fight alongside your friends, you know that you sometimes must face a mighty villain alone. Starting at 10th level, when you use your Moment of Greatness feature, choose one creature you can see or hear. For 1 minute, or until you are {@condition incapacitated}, roll a {@dice d6} when that creature hits you with an attack roll. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses you, regardless of its roll.

subclassFeature.name: Hour of Triumph
entries: Beginning at 14th level, you can truly invoke your patron and lead your companions to victory. When you use Moment of Greatness, you can choose any number of creatures within 60 feet of you that can see or hear you. They gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier for 1 hour and until the beginning of your next turn, they have advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
